title: How Donald Trump is rewriting US history
subhed: As the country marks its 250th anniversary this year, the American president, who returned to the White House on January 20, 2025, has worked to shape a revised historical narrative, revealing signs of megalomania.

title: Jimmy Lai, Hong Kong's pro-democracy media mogul, sentenced to 20 years in prison
byline: By Florence de Changy (Hong Kong, correspondent)

title: Bad Bunny brings Puerto Rico's culture to Super Bowl halftime show, with a Lady Gaga surprise
byline: Le Monde with AP and AFP

title: British PM Starmer faces turmoil over Epstein scandal
subhed: Morgan McSweeney, PM Keir Starmer's chief of staff, announced his resignation on Sunday. He was once a protégé of former minister and ambassador to the US Peter Mandelson, who fell from grace over his friendship with deceased sex offender Jeffrey Epstein.

title: Portugal: Socialist Antonio José Seguro elected president, beating far right
subhed: His opponent, André Ventura, founder and leader of the far-right Chega party, garnered more votes than in the May 2025 parliamentary elections, and has established himself as a key figure in the country's political scene.

title: AI's impact on entire sectors of the economy shakes Wall Street
subhed: Investors have abandoned sectors like software in favor of the traditional Dow Jones, which has broken through the 50,000-point mark.
byline: By Nicolas Chapuis (New York (United States) correspondent)

title: Mayor and mother: The young women changing France's local councils
subhed: Only 41 women under the age of 30 were elected as mayors in 2020, out of France's 34,885 mayors. Here are the stories of several women who have balanced their careers, motherhood and first terms in office in a political scene often dominated by older men.

2026 Super Bowl: Bad Bunny, the anti-Trump icon made in Puerto Rico
subhed: On Sunday, in front of tens of millions of television viewers, the Puerto Rican reggaeton phenomenon will headline the Super Bowl halftime show, on the heels of winning Album of the Year at the Grammys. But, at a time when the ruthless crackdown on undocumented immigrants is raging in the US, inviting this Latin icon to one of America's major events was always bound to anger Donald Trump.

title: Jacob Helberg, Trump's direct link to France's far right
subhed: Everyone in the French far right who wants to get close to Donald Trump knows that Jacob Helberg is the man to speak to. The French-American, a young under secretary of state for economic affairs, serves as a conduit for the reactionary, nationalist and anti-immigration vision that the president wants to impose on Europe.

title: Robert Crumb, comic book author: 'I am a paranoid person and I make fun of that'
subhed: In 'Tales of Paranoia,' the legend of American counterculture comics takes readers on a dizzying journey into the world of madness, illustrated with a case study: Robert Crumb.
